content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had the conversation with Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Max Müller

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price of an apartment in Magdeburg.
name: Max Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Max Müller

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Since we did not agree on a final price, I cannot provide an exact number. The highest offer I made was 950 Euro, but Peter Schmidt from Germany did not find this price acceptable and did not wish to continue the negotiation.
name: Max Müller

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner as a 5 on a scale from 1 to 10. This is because while Peter Schmidt was polite and willing to negotiate, he did not seem to be flexible enough to reach a mutual agreement, which made the negotiation somewhat difficult.
name: Max Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. The conversation remained respectful and focused on the terms of the lease, without any personal attacks or discriminatory remarks.
name: Max Müller

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: Since I did not feel discriminated or offended, I cannot provide a reason for such an occurrence. The negotiation ended without any personal issues.
name: Max Müller
